Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: barracks room of Doloreaux Manor

This is the barracks room of the Doloreaux Manor. It is comprised of four smooth gray stone walls, a hardwood floor, and a simple plastered ceiling. The east and west sides of the area are entirely populated with bunk beds covered in green linens, which can comfortably accommodate up to two sleepers in each individual unit. There is a cedar weapon rack in the northwest corner and a matching cedar armor rack in the northeast corner. A closet door to the north is in the middle of the north wall.. Solid oak doors have been centrally-built into the western wall west, lending access to the training yard, while the southern door. The south door leads south to the common room of the barracks, two cedar L-shaped counters frame the south door.
A barracks room of the DoloreauxManor.
This is the barracks room of the Doloreaux Manor. It is comprised of four smooth gray stone walls, a hardwood floor, and a simple plastered ceiling.

thin oak door leading into the training yard
A thin oak door leading into the training yard.
solid oak door
A solid oak door provides an exit to the brick-walled courtyard.
solid oak door
A solid oak door leading to the common room of the barracks.
the northern wall

The northern wall of a barracks room. It is comprised entirely of smooth gray stone aside from the centermost portion, which breaks to display a solid oak door leading out to the brick-walled courtyard.
The northern wall of a barracks room.
the southern wall

The southern wall of a barracks room. It is comprised entirely of smooth gray stone down aside from the centermost portion, at which point it breaks to display a solid oak door leading to the common room of the barracks.
The southern wall of a barracks room.
the top bunk of the northeastern bunk bed
Supported by sturdy cedar planks is a thin mattress covered with neatly turned pale olive linen sheets, emerald green wool comforters, and generously fluffed cotton pillow.
A thin mattress with green blue sheets, a green blue wool blanket, and generously stuffed cotton pillow.

northeastern bunk bed

A simple, sturdy cedar bunk bed situated against the east wall. It features both a bottom and top bunk, the latter of which can be accessed via the ladder attached to the upper left-hand side. Each bed has been methodically prepared; the thin mattresses covered with neatly turned olive linen sheets, emerald green wool comforters, and generously fluffed cotton pillows.
